summary: New AI stock CoreWeave had its initial public offering in March 2025 . The company anticipates sustained revenue growth but faces financial risks, including operating at a loss . The AI sector remains a robust investment opportunity as organizations around the world race to build artificial intelligence .  CoreWeave delivers cloud computing infrastructure to businesses hungry for more computing capacity for their AI systems . The company's first-quarter revenue rose a whopping 420% year over year to $981.6 million . Microsoft,IBM, and OpenAI are among its roster of customers .  At the end of Q1, CoreWeave had amassed a revenue backlog of $25.9 billion, up 63% year over year thanks to a deal with OpenAI . The company forecasts 2025 full-year revenue to come in between $4.9 and $5.1 billion .  CoreWeave exited Q1 with $18.8 billion in total liabilities on its balance sheet, and $8.7 billion of that was debt . As it adds customers, the company must expand its data centers to keep pace .  CoreWeave's share price surged over recent weeks, causing its P/S multiple to skyrocket past that of Nvidia and Microsoft . Only investors with a high risk tolerance should consider buying shares . Given its pricey stock and shaky financials, the ideal approach is to put CoreWeaves on your watch list .  The Motley Fool's total average return is792% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to171% for the S&P 500 . Don’t miss out on the latest top 10 list, available when you join Stock Advisor .  The Motley Fool recommends Microsoft, Nvidia, and CoreWeave stockholders . The company has more than 1.6 million employees . CoreWeaves is a subsidiary of Machines Machines .

Cash levels at blue-chip companies are shrinking, when excluding results from most-cash-rich corporations . Among members of the S&P 500 that have posted results, cash levels for the latest quarter fell nearly 1% . That’s according to a Bloomberg News analysis that focuses on non-financial companies with less than $30 billion of cash .  Trade wars are a particular concern now as escalating trade wars potentially boost the cost of foreign inputs, weigh on profits, and increase inflation . Spreads on US high-grade corporate debt averaged just 0.85% on Friday, the tightest level since March .  The top 12 biggest holders of cash saw their holdings rise about 1.4%, to around $756.7 billion . The dozen companies each have more than $30 billion of cash and marketable securities on their books . Investment-grade firms are holding more cash as a share of their assets than they have on average over the past decade .  Some money managers are stopping short of saying it’s time to prepare for the worst . A close look does show some signs of weakness, at least in the smaller firms . Corporate profits for domestic, non-financial companies declined by about 3% in the first quarter .  Elon Musk is selling $5 billion of debt to help fund his artificial intelligence startup xAI . The sale may be complicated by a very public feud between Trump and Musk . Hong Kong developer New World Development Co. is sliding deeper into distress after its recent decision to delay interest payments on some bonds .  JPMorgan Chase & Co. is sounding out investors for an almost $2 billion loan for Trucordia . Owens & Minor canceled its planned purchase of Rotech Healthcare Holdings, sending its bonds on a wild ride . Banks and private credit funds are competing with each other to provide as much as €2.5 billion of debt to insurance broker Diot-Siaci Group .  German autoparts maker ZF Friedrichshafen AG pulls in more than €4.5 billion in orders for a new bond sale . Delta Air Lines sells $2 billion of investment-grade bonds to help repay a government loan it took out during the pandemic to pay employees . 23andMe will hold a second auction for its cache of DNA data .  MUFG Securities Americas has hired two longtime leveraged loan bankers . EchoStar Corp., the wireless and pay-TV operator controlled by billionaire Charlie Ergen, has decided to skip interest payments on three bonds . Lane42 Investment Partners founder Scott Graves is building out his senior leadership team .  Nick Campregher, formerly at ExodusPoint Capital Management, started last month . Won Choi joined from Maven Investment Partners to oversee credit opportunities and special situations . Before moving to the asset management industry, he had spent about a decade at UBS Group AG .

Nvidia is currently the world's largest company by market cap . The semiconductor giant still has a lot of room for growth, considering the potential investment in artificial intelligence (AI) infrastructure over the next five years . Nvidia has additional catalysts coming into play that could allow it to sustain terrific growth and hit a $6 trillion valuation in the future .  Nvidia's revenue shot up 69% year over year to $44.1 billion during the first quarter of fiscal 2026 . The chipmaker lost $2.5 billion in revenue in fiscal Q1, owing to restrictions on sales of its chips to China . Nvidia's guidance for the current quarter still calls for a 50% year-on-year growth .  CEO Jensen Huang admitted on Nvidia's latest earnings conference call that the $50 billion Chinese market is now effectively closed to U.S. players such as Nvidia . That's not surprising, as Nvidia still has a massive sales opportunity in AI chips beyond the Chinese market .  Nvidia is showing no signs of losing its grip over the AI chip market . Its data center revenue shot up an impressive 73% year over year to $39 billion in the previous quarter . That was miles ahead of Broadcom's $4 billion AI revenue and AMD's $3.7 billion data center sales .  Nvidia is currently a major hit among cloud computing giants within two quarters of hitting the market . It also offers access to models that help customers train and deploy AI agents, along with other enterprise AI applications . Its enterprise platforms are gaining traction in diverse industries such as cybersecurity and restaurants .  Nvidia is trading at 23 times sales, three times the U.S. technology sector's average price-to-sales ratio . The company's dominant position in AI chips, the prospects of this market, and the other catalysts that are coming into play help justify that valuation . Nvidia's top line is expected to jump to $292 billion in three years .  The Motley Fool's total average return is792% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to171% for the S&P 500 . Consider when Netflixmade this list on December 17, 2004... if you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $669,517!  Artificial Intelligence Stock Could Hit a $6 Trillion Valuation by 2030 . of June 2, 2025 Harsh Chauhanhas no position in any of the stocks mentioned .

While Netflix, Amazon, and Nvidia have delivered spectacular returns, they lack the diversification needed for a single-stock portfolio . Berkshire Hathaway operates like an expertly curated ETF, owning 68 distinct companies . Despite not owning Berkshire myself, I recognize it as the safest choice for investors seeking a single long-term holding .  Netflix was an early name in my portfolio, inspired by fellow Fool Rick Munarriz's in-depth analysis of the company in the mid-2000s . When Netflix went through the Qwikster-branded separation of DVD and streaming services, I doubled down on my investment at a fantastic price .  My oldest Amazon investment is only up by 430% since January 2017 . I wish I had pounced on Amazon much earlier, like Motley Fool co-founders Tom and David Gardner did . Amazon is not a one-trick pony, but the company should pick up a few more skills .  The early leader in AI accelerator hardware could very well run into a superior alternative in the next few years . The risk only grows larger if you stretch the timeline out over decades . The next market-defining AI winner could be some upstart I haven't heard of yet .  Berkshire Hathaway owns and operates 68 distinct companies these days . The names range from GEICO car insurance to Duracell batteries . Berkshire dabbles in e-commerce (Oriental Trading Company) and clothing (Fruit of the Loom)  Berkshire Hathaway owns a $60.7 billion stake in Apple, $45.1 billion in American Express and $28.5 billion in Coca-Cola . Buffett is all about diversity, shielding the company and its investors against the temporary ups and downs in any one particular industry .  Berkshire Hathaway is a safer long-term bet than Nvidia, Netflix, or Amazon . The Motley Fool's total average return is792% -- a market-crushing outperformance compared to171% for the S&P 500 . The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years .  John Mackey, former CEO of Whole Foods Market, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors . American Express is an advertising partner of Motiley Fool Money .

Broadcom reported strong earnings for Q2 2025, beating Wall Street estimates . Multi-faceted tech company known for producing custom silicon chips and infrastructure software products . Broadcom remains consistently overshadowed by Nvidia, the chipmaking industry’s undisputed leader .  Broadcom has posted strong quarterly results, coming in above Wall Street estimates on earnings-per-share (EPS) and issuing strong revenue guidance . This shows progress from the chipmaker as it maneuvers to stay ahead in a highly volatile market and compete with other semiconductor producers .  Broadcom is “basically Nvidia’s baby brother” with a slightly lower trillion-dollar market cap . Woods adds that many large-cap tech stocks have struggled to reach new highs lately, citing Microsoft(MSFT)as a key example .  BofA Securities analyst Vivek Aryarecently raised his price target to $300 per share . Seaport Research reiterated a Buy rating on AVGO on June 4, citing the company’s new Tomahawk .  AVGO describes this new AI chip as a ‘turning point in AI infrastructure design’ Laffer Tengler Investments CEO: AVGO stock’s valuation is full but still fair, even after its recent rally .

Nvidia's catalysts across multiple industries could drive solid growth for the next five years . The company's data center business is growing at a nice pace . Even considering its current valuation, based on its potential earnings growth, the stock seems primed to head higher .  The data center business was once again the driving force behind Nvidia's impressive results, growing 73% year over year . The company also benefited from the growing adoption of its chips in two other areas . Nvidia is set to benefit from the proliferation of AI in multiple end markets .  Global investment in AI infrastructure is expected to hit a humongous $7 trillion by 2030, according to a forecast by McKinsey . Nearly three-fourths of that will be directed toward data centers . Huang believes sovereign AI is set to become the next big growth driver for Nvidia .  Its revenue from the gaming and AI PC segment shot up 48% from the year-ago period to a record $3.8 billion . The year-over-year growth of its automotive and robotics revenue nearly matched that of its data center business . Both these segments can keep growing at elevated levels over the next five years thanks to AI .  Analysts' consensus estimates are for Nvidia's earnings to increase by 43% in the current fiscal year to $4.28 per share . Nvidia seems well equipped to sustain solid growth rates over the next five years on account of its dominant presence in these multibillion-dollar markets .  Nvidia is currently trading at 31 times forward earnings, a discount to its five-year average multiple of 40 . following fiscal 2028, its earnings could hit $9.50 per share after five years . That points toward a potential gain of 73% from current levels .  The Motley Fool’s total average return is792% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to171% for the S&P 500 . If you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $868,615!

Taiwan Semiconductor specializes in foundry services that bring chip designs from Nvidia and others to life . Industry estimates suggest that spending on AI infrastructure will continue rising over the next five years . Investing $1,000 in TSMC stock has the potential to generate multibagger gains .  Taiwan Semi specializes in foundry services that manufacture the chip designs from Nvidia, AMD, and many others . Cloud hyperscalers such asMicrosoft,Alphabet, andAmazon, as well as big tech giantsMeta PlatformsandOracle, have been buying GPUs in droves over the last few years in an effort to build out data centers .  Taiwan Semi's revenue, gross profit, and net income are accelerating in parallel with sales . It's worth noting that technology investors Cathie Wood and Stanley Druckenmiller recently added Taiwan Semi stock to their portfolios .  A $1,000 investment in Taiwan Semi stock 10 years ago is now worth approximately $8,500 . Achieving almost a tenfold return in 10 years is impressive -- even for a growth stock . This underscores the idea that holding on to a stock for long-term periods can lead to outsized gains .  Taiwan Semi's future growth prospects are arguably far more robust than they were 10 years ago . Nvidia remains a must-own stock for AI investors . SoundHound AI could provide even bigger gains . The AI market could grow by 30% or more per year over the next decade and beyond .  AI spending has been skyrocketing in recent years, with most forecasts calling for double-digit percentage growth . Nvidia now controls roughly 90% of the market for GPUs destined to support AI applications . Nvidia's dominance in the market is no joke .  Nvidia may not be able to maintain its high market share, technological superiority, or high gross margins forever . Even if it does cede some market share and profitability, there's a good chance the company can continue to grow at double-digit percentage rates . Nvidia is now worth more than $3.4 trillion -- in the past week, it has been neck and neck with Microsoft for the title of world's largest company .  SoundHound AI's business involves AI technologies within the audio arena . Think drive-thru windows where your order is taken by an AI agent . The voice AI segment of the market is expected to grow by 30% to 40% per year .  SoundHound certainly has all the right pieces in place to deliver 20% annual returns over the next decade and beyond . You'll have to get comfortable with the stock's premium valuation though: Shares trade at nearly 40 times sales . Advanced Micro Devices stock looks undervalued amid growing demand for its data center chips . Constellation Software is a growth machine that has a huge opportunity in the vertical software industry . The following companies are serving growing demand in the semiconductor and software industries .  Data center revenue grew 57% year over year last quarter, but that's before AMD completed the acquisition of ZT Systems . This deal will allow AMD to supply data centers with rack-level AI computing systems combining AMD's GPUs, central processing units (CPUs), networking chips, and software . Amazon Web Services rolled out new AI workloads running on its Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud in the first quarter .  Canada-based Constellation Software is one of the best-performing growth stocks that doesn't get much attention on Wall Street . The company has delivered impressive growth over the last decade operating in the vertical software industry . Amazon's investment signals that AMD still has a valuable role to play in the chip supply chain .  Constellation focuses on acquiring software companies with above-average growth, profitability, and excellent management . Once acquired, Constellation improves their performance, which increases returns for shareholders . Revenue and free cash flow have grown at a compound annual rate of about 20% over the last 10 years .  Advanced Micro Devices. at over $150 billion and expected to grow at an annualized rate of 13%, according to Future Market Insights. This would bring the industry to over $500 billion by 2034. Constellation's annual revenue is just over $10 billion .  Don’t miss out on the latest top 10 list, available when you joinStock Fool's Stock Advisor Stock Show . The Motley Fool has a new list of 10 No. 2 No. 1 No-Brainer Stocks .

Palantir Technologies' stock has handily outperformed Nvidia so far this year . The company's rapidly growing commercial revenue is one of its biggest tailwinds . The Trump administration's trade policies could weigh on Nvidia . However, the company's sky-high valuation could become a problem .  Palantir's U.S. commercial total contract booking value soared 183% year over year to $810 million in Q1 . The prospects of congressional passage of President Trump's "Big, Beautiful Bill" have also excited shareholders . Nvidia's export restrictions on artificial intelligence chips have created a dark cloud .  Palantir's commercial revenue will keep growing robustly in the second half of the year . Nvidia's Blackwell GPUs will remain a smashing commercial success, I predict .  Palantir has the fastest ramp-up in its history . I look for Blackwell's profit margins to improve as the year progresses . I'm not sure about whether the "Big, Beautiful Bill" will pass the Senate in its current form . It's also possible that the federal courts will ultimately pull the rug from underneath his efforts to levy steep across-the-board tariffs .  Nvidia's growth is slowing, but the GPU maker's shares trade at 32 times forward earnings . Palantir's forward earnings multiple is nearly 244. If the company's growth were accelerating, that might not be so alarming . Nvidia is a better stock to own over the long term . Netflix shares trade significantly higher than the levels they did before the company's last stock split in 2015 . Netflix expects double-digit revenue growth and significant operating margin expansion this year . The streaming giant's performance has been stellar. In the first quarter of 2025, revenue rose 12.5% year over year to about $10.5 billion .  Netflix's operating margin hit 31.7% in the first quarter, up from 28.1% . The company also reported free cash flow of $2.7 billion, up 25% year over year . Netflix hasn't split its shares since 2015, a 7-for-1 split lowered the company's share price .  Netflix shares currently trade far higher than other tech giants like Microsoft and Nvidia . A stock split would lower the price per share and make Netflix more accessible to retail investors . Splits are more likely when a stock becomes expensive and the company is on solid footing .  Netflix is a top contender for the next big tech stock split . Investors seem to be betting on more staggering growth from the streaming giant . Shares trade at 59 times earnings, a price-to-earnings multiple well in excess of Nvidia's . Nvidia shares are up 850% since ChatGPT sparked the artificial intelligence (AI) boom . The company is the market leader in AI accelerator chips, but its true strength lies in vertical integration . Among 73 analysts following Nvidia, the median 12-month target price is $175 per share .  Nvidia has over 90% market share in data centergraphics processing units(GPUs) Chips that accelerate complex workloads such as artificial intelligence (AI) Could Nvidia stock turn $50,000 into $1 million over the next decade?  Nvidia frequently sets performance records at the MLPerf benchmarks . Wall Street expects earnings to grow at 40% annually through the fiscal year ending January 2027 . Nvidia shares would need to increase 1,900% (20-fold) in the next decade .  The company is already worth $3.4 trillion, meaning its market value would hit $68 trillion if the stock increased 20 times . That seems highly unlikely when the entire S&P 500 is only worth $48 trillion today . However, Nvidia is still a worthwhile investment .  The Motley Fool's total average return is997% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 . Nvidia's CEO, Jensen Huang, has shown an uncanny knack for knowing when it's time to pivot or innovate . Great companies don't allow the competition to out-innovate; so far, that's been true of Nvidia .  Nvidia released its earnings for Q1 fiscal 2026 on May 28, and reported revenue of $44.1 billion . The company is under pressure because of export restrictions on selling its AI chips in China . Its success in super-fast chips and software allowed it to exploit the crypto boom .  The U.S. government announced it would require a license to export Nvidia's H20 chip to China, making Nvidia unable to ship an additional $2.5 billion worth of H20 products during Q1 . Management's fiscal second quarter outlook remains impressive: Revenue is expected to be $45.0 billion, plus or minus 2% .  Bank of America Global Research Media hosted Nvidia CFO Colette Kress and VP IR Toshiya Hari for an investor dinner in San Francisco . In fiscal Q1, Blackwell represented about 70% of compute sales . Blackwell Ultra production will begin in fiscal Q2 for a second-half volume ramp .  Third-party estimates suggest 5 to 7 gigawatts of data center capacity will be installed this year . Nvidia's data center opportunity should be worth between $250 billion and $350 billion, with a pipeline of approximately $175 billion .  Nvidia is best positioned to benefit from the ongoing AI tide, supported by a multi-year lead in performance (AI scaling), pipeline, pipeline, incumbency, scale, and developer support .
